header.div: IELTS Writing Task 1 consists of two parts: the rubric and the task itself. Read the Writing Task on the left and then answer the questions about the rubric on the right.

section.p: You should spend about 20 minutes on this task.

p.b: Your English teacher has found a new penfriend for you.
Write a letter to the penfriend and introduce yourself. Tell them what you like doing in your free time. Ask your penfriend to tell you about their hobbies and interests.

section.p: You should write at least 150 words.
You do NOT need to write your own address.

ol.li:
How long should you spend on Writing Task 1?
about minutes

How many words do you have to write?
at least words
What isn't it necessary to include in the letter?

section.p: It's important to familiarise yourself with what you're expected to do in Writing Task 1. You need to know how much time you have and how many words you have to write.
